data.name: AssemblyCleanupShouldBeValidDescription
data.value:
Methods marked with '[AssemblyCleanup]' should follow the following layout to be valid: -it can't be declared on a generic class -it should be 'public' -it should be 'static' -it should not be 'async void' -it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...). -it should not be generic -it should either not take any parameter, or take a single parameter of type 'TestContext' -return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask'
The type declaring these methods should also respect the following rules: -The type should be a class -The class should be 'public' or 'internal' (if the test project is using the '[DiscoverInternals]' attribute) -The class shouldn't be 'static' -The class should be marked with '[TestClass]' (or a derived attribute) -the class should not be generic.

data.name: AssemblyCleanupShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: AssemblyCleanup method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: AssemblyCleanupShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: AssemblyCleanup methods should have valid layout

data.name: AssemblyInitializeShouldBeValidDescription
data.value:
Methods marked with '[AssemblyInitialize]' should follow the following layout to be valid: -it can't be declared on a generic class -it should be 'public' -it should be 'static' -it should not be 'async void' -it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...). -it should not be generic -it should take one parameter of type 'TestContext' -return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask'
The type declaring these methods should also respect the following rules: -The type should be a class -The class should be 'public' or 'internal' (if the test project is using the '[DiscoverInternals]' attribute) -The class shouldn't be 'static' -The class should be marked with '[TestClass]' (or a derived attribute) -the class should not be generic.

data.name: AssemblyInitializeShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: AssemblyInitialize method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: AssemblyInitializeShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: AssemblyInitialize methods should have valid layout

data.name: AssertionArgsShouldAvoidConditionalAccessMessageFormat
data.value: Prefer adding an additional assertion that checks for null

data.name: AssertionArgsShouldAvoidConditionalAccessTitle
data.value: Avoid conditional access in assertions

data.name: AssertionArgsShouldBePassedInCorrectOrderDescription
data.value: 'Assert.AreEqual', 'Assert.AreNotEqual', 'Assert.AreSame' and 'Assert.AreNotSame' expects the expected value to be passed first and the actual value to be passed as second argument.

data.name: AssertionArgsShouldBePassedInCorrectOrderMessageFormat
data.value: Assertion arguments should be passed in the correct order. 'actual' and 'expected'/'notExpected' arguments have been swapped.

data.name: AssertionArgsShouldBePassedInCorrectOrderTitle
data.value: Assertion arguments should be passed in the correct order

data.name: AvoidExpectedExceptionAttributeDescription
data.value: Prefer 'Assert.ThrowsExactly' or 'Assert.ThrowsExactlyAsync' over '[ExpectedException]' as it ensures that only the expected call throws the expected exception. The assert APIs also provide more flexibility and allow you to assert extra properties of the exception.

data.name: AvoidExpectedExceptionAttributeMessageFormat
data.value: Prefer 'Assert.ThrowsExactly/ThrowsExactlyAsync' over '[ExpectedException]'

data.name: AvoidExpectedExceptionAttributeTitle
data.value: Avoid '[ExpectedException]'

data.name: ClassCleanupShouldBeValidDescription
data.value:
Methods marked with '[ClassCleanup]' should follow the following layout to be valid: -it can't be declared on a generic class without the 'InheritanceBehavior' mode is set -it should be 'public' -it should be 'static' -it should not be 'async void' -it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...). -it should not be generic -it should either not take any parameter, or take a single parameter of type 'TestContext' -return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask' -'InheritanceBehavior.BeforeEachDerivedClass' attribute parameter should be specified if the class is 'abstract' -'InheritanceBehavior.BeforeEachDerivedClass' attribute parameter should not be specified if the class is 'sealed'
The type declaring these methods should also respect the following rules: -The type should be a class -The class should be 'public' or 'internal' (if the test project is using the '[DiscoverInternals]' attribute) -The class shouldn't be 'static' -If the class is 'sealed', it should be marked with '[TestClass]' (or a derived attribute) -the class should not be generic.

data.name: ClassCleanupShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: ClassCleanup method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: ClassCleanupShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: ClassCleanup methods should have valid layout

data.name: ClassInitializeShouldBeValidDescription
data.value:
Methods marked with '[ClassInitialize]' should follow the following layout to be valid: -it can't be declared on a generic class without the 'InheritanceBehavior' mode is set -it should be 'public' -it should be 'static' -it should not be 'async void' -it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...). -it should not be generic -it should take one parameter of type 'TestContext' -return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask' -'InheritanceBehavior.BeforeEachDerivedClass' attribute parameter should be specified if the class is 'abstract' -'InheritanceBehavior.BeforeEachDerivedClass' attribute parameter should not be specified if the class is 'sealed'
The type declaring these methods should also respect the following rules: -The type should be a class -The class should be 'public' or 'internal' (if the test project is using the '[DiscoverInternals]' attribute) -The class shouldn't be 'static' -If the class is 'sealed', it should be marked with '[TestClass]' (or a derived attribute) -the class should not be generic.

data.name: ClassInitializeShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: ClassInitialize method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: ClassInitializeShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: ClassInitialize methods should have valid layout

data.name: DataRowShouldBeValidDescription
DataRowShouldBeValidMessageFormat_ArgumentCountMismatch
data.value: DataRow argument count should match method parameter count (constructor arguments: {0}, method parameters: {1})

data.name: DataRowShouldBeValidMessageFormat_ArgumentTypeMismatch
data.value: DataRow argument types do not match method parameter types. {0}

data.name: DataRowShouldBeValidMessageFormat_ParameterMismatch
data.value: Parameter '{0}' expects type '{1}', but the provided value has type '{2}'

data.name: DataRowShouldBeValidMessageFormat_OnTestMethod
data.value: DataRow should only be set on a test method

data.name: DataRowShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: DataRow should be valid

data.name: DoNotNegateBooleanAssertionMessageFormat
data.value: Do not negate boolean assertions, instead use the opposite assertion

data.name: DoNotNegateBooleanAssertionTitle
data.value: Do not negate boolean assertions

data.name: DoNotStoreStaticTestContextAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Do not store TestContext in a static member

data.name: DoNotStoreStaticTestContextAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Do not store TestContext in a static member

data.name: PreferAssertFailOverAlwaysFalseConditionsMessageFormat
data.value: Use 'Assert.Fail' instead of an always-failing 'Assert.{0}' assert

data.name: PreferAssertFailOverAlwaysFalseConditionsTitle
data.value: Use 'Assert.Fail' instead of an always-failing assert

data.name: PreferConstructorOverTestInitializeMessageFormat
data.value: Prefer constructors over TestInitialize methods

data.name: PreferConstructorOverTestInitializeTitle
data.value: Prefer constructors over TestInitialize methods

data.name: PreferDisposeOverTestCleanupMessageFormat
data.value: Prefer 'Dispose' over TestCleanup methods

data.name: PreferDisposeOverTestCleanupTitle
data.value: Prefer 'Dispose' over TestCleanup methods

data.name: PreferTestCleanupOverDisposeMessageFormat
data.value: Prefer TestCleanup over 'Dispose' methods

data.name: PreferTestCleanupOverDisposeTitle
data.value: Prefer TestCleanup over 'Dispose' methods

data.name: PreferTestInitializeOverConstructorMessageFormat
data.value: Prefer TestInitialize methods over constructors

data.name: PreferTestInitializeOverConstructorTitle
data.value: Prefer TestInitialize methods over constructors

data.name: PublicMethodShouldBeTestMethodAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Public methods should be test methods (marked with `[TestMethod]`).

data.name: PublicMethodShouldBeTestMethodAnalyzerFormat
data.value: Public method '{0}' should be a test method

data.name: PublicMethodShouldBeTestMethodAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Public methods should be test methods

data.name: PublicTypeShouldBeTestClassDescription
data.value: It's considered a good practice to have only test classes marked public in a test project.

data.name: PublicTypeShouldBeTestClassMessageFormat
data.value: Public type '{0}' should be marked with '[TestClass]' or changed to 'internal'

data.name: PublicTypeShouldBeTestClassTitle
data.value: Public types should be test classes

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidDescription
data.value: Test classes, classes marked with the '[TestClass]' attribute, should respect the following layout to be considered valid by MSTest: - it should be 'public' (or 'internal' if '[assembly: DiscoverInternals]' attribute is set) - it should not be 'static' (except if it contains only 'AssemblyInitialize' and/or 'AssemblyCleanup' methods) - it should not be generic.

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: Test classes should have valid layout

data.name: TestClassShouldHaveTestMethodDescription
data.value: Test class should have at least one test method or be 'static' with method(s) marked by '[AssemblyInitialize]' and/or '[AssemblyCleanup]'.

data.name: TestClassShouldHaveTestMethodMessageFormat
data.value: Test class '{0}' should have at least one test method or be 'static' with method(s) marked by '[AssemblyInitialize]' and/or '[AssemblyCleanup]'

data.name: TestClassShouldHaveTestMethodTitle
data.value: Test class should have test method

data.name: TestCleanupShouldBeValidDescription
data.value:
Methods marked with '[TestCleanup]' should follow the following layout to be valid: -it should be 'public' -it should not be 'abstract' -it should not be 'async void' -it should not be 'static' -it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...). -it should not be generic -it should not take any parameter -return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask'
The type declaring these methods should also respect the following rules: -The type should be a class -The class should be 'public' or 'internal' (if the test project is using the '[DiscoverInternals]' attribute) -The class shouldn't be 'static' -If the class is 'sealed', it should be marked with '[TestClass]' (or a derived attribute).

data.name: TestCleanupShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: TestCleanup method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: TestCleanupShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: TestCleanup method should have valid layout

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidDescription
data.value: 'TestContext' should be a non-static field or property assigned in constructor or for a property set by MSTest, it should follow the layout: - it should be 'public' regardless of whether '[assembly: DiscoverInternals]' attribute is set or not. - it should not be 'static' - it should have a setter.

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: Property 'TestContext' should be valid

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: Test context property should have valid layout

data.name: TestInitializeShouldBeValidDescription
data.value:
Methods marked with '[TestInitialize]' should follow the following layout to be valid: -it should be 'public' -it should not be 'abstract' -it should not be 'async void' -it should not be 'static' -it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...). -it should not be generic -it should not take any parameter -return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask'
The type declaring these methods should also respect the following rules: -The type should be a class -The class should be 'public' or 'internal' (if the test project is using the '[DiscoverInternals]' attribute) -The class shouldn't be 'static' -If the class is 'sealed', it should be marked with '[TestClass]' (or a derived attribute).

data.name: TestInitializeShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: TestInitialize method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: TestInitializeShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: TestInitialize method should have valid layout

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidDescription
data.value: Test methods, methods marked with the '[TestMethod]' attribute, should respect the following layout to be considered valid by MSTest: - it should be 'public' (or 'internal' if '[assembly: DiscoverInternals]' attribute is set) - it should not be 'static' - it should may be generic as long as type parameters can be inferred and argument types are compatible - it should not be 'abstract' - return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask' - it should not be 'async void' - it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...).

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: Test method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: Test methods should have valid layout

data.name: TestMethodShouldNotBeIgnoredAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Test methods should not be ignored (marked with '[Ignore]').

data.name: TestMethodShouldNotBeIgnoredAnalyzerFormat
data.value: Test method '{0}' should not be ignored

data.name: TestMethodShouldNotBeIgnoredAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Test method should not be ignored

data.name: UseAsyncSuffixTestFixtureMethodSuppressorJustification
data.value: Asynchronous test fixture methods do not require the 'Async' suffix

data.name: UseAsyncSuffixTestMethodSuppressorJustification
data.value: Asynchronous test methods do not require the 'Async' suffix

data.name: UnusedParameterSuppressorJustification
data.value: TestContext parameter is required by MSTest for AssemblyInitialize and ClassInitialize methods

data.name: UseAttributeOnTestMethodAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: [{0}] can only be set on methods marked with [TestMethod]

data.name: UseAttributeOnTestMethodAnalyzerTitle
data.value: [{0}] can only be set on methods marked with [TestMethod]

data.name: UseParallelizeAttributeAnalyzerDescription
data.value: By default, MSTest runs tests within the same assembly sequentially, which can lead to severe performance limitations. It is recommended to enable assembly attribute '[Parallelize]' to run tests in parallel, or if the assembly is known to not be parallelizable, to use explicitly the assembly level attribute '[DoNotParallelize]'.

data.name: UseParallelizeAttributeAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Explicitly enable or disable tests parallelization

data.name: UseParallelizeAttributeAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Explicitly enable or disable tests parallelization

data.name: TypeContainingTestMethodShouldBeATestClassTitle
data.value: Type containing '[TestMethod]' should be marked with '[TestClass]'

data.name: TypeContainingTestMethodShouldBeATestClassDescription
data.value: Type containing '[TestMethod]' should be marked with '[TestClass]', otherwise the test method will be silently ignored.

data.name: TypeContainingTestMethodShouldBeATestClassMessageFormat
data.value: Type '{0}' contains test methods and should be marked with '[TestClass]'

data.name: DoNotUseSystemDescriptionAttributeTitle
data.value: 'System.ComponentModel.DescriptionAttribute' has no effect on test methods

data.name: DoNotUseSystemDescriptionAttributeMessageFormat
data.value: Did you mean to be using 'Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UnitTesting.DescriptionAttribute'?

data.name: DoNotUseSystemDescriptionAttributeDescription
data.value: 'System.ComponentModel.DescriptionAttribute' has no effect in the context of tests and you likely wanted to use 'Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UnitTesting.DescriptionAttribute' instead.

data.name: ReviewAlwaysTrueAssertConditionAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Assertion condition is always true

data.name: ReviewAlwaysTrueAssertConditionAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Review or remove the assertion as its condition is known to be always true

data.name: UseClassCleanupBehaviorEndOfClassTitle
data.value: Use 'ClassCleanupBehavior.EndOfClass' with the '[ClassCleanup]'

data.name: UseClassCleanupBehaviorEndOfClassDescription
data.value: Without using 'ClassCleanupBehavior.EndOfClass', the '[ClassCleanup]' will by default be run at the end of the assembly and not at the end of the class.

data.name: UseClassCleanupBehaviorEndOfClassMessageFormat
data.value: Use 'ClassCleanupBehavior.EndOfClass' with the '[ClassCleanup]'

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: DynamicData should be valid

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidDescription
DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_OnTestMethod
data.value: '[DynamicData]' should only be set on a test method

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_MemberNotFound
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' cannot be found

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_TooManyMembers
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' is found more than once

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_SourceTypeProperty
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' is a property so you should use 'DynamicDataSourceType.AutoDetect' or 'DynamicDataSourceType.Property' (auto detect is the default when not specified explicitly, and is recommended)

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_MemberMethod
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' should be a method

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_MemberType
data.value: '[DynamicData]' referenced member '{0}.{1}' should return 'IEnumerable<object[]>', 'IEnumerable<Tuple>` or 'IEnumerable<ValueTuple>'

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_SourceTypeMethod
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' is a method so you should use 'DynamicDataSourceType.AutoDetect' or 'DynamicDataSourceType.Method' (auto detect is the default when not specified explicitly, and is recommended)

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_SourceTypeField
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' is a field so you should use 'DynamicDataSourceType.AutoDetect' or 'DynamicDataSourceType.Field' (auto detect is the default when not specified explicitly, and is recommended)

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_DisplayMethodSignature
data.value: '[DynamicData]' display name method '{0}.{1}' signature is invalid

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_DataMemberSignature
data.value: '[DynamicData]' data member '{0}.{1}' signature is invalid

data.name: UseDeploymentItemWithTestMethodOrTestClassTitle
data.value: '[DeploymentItem]' can be specified only on test class or test method

data.name: UseDeploymentItemWithTestMethodOrTestClassMessageFormat
data.value: '[DeploymentItem]' can be specified only on test class or test method

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: Test class '{0}' should be valid

data.name: DoNotUseShadowingDescription
data.value: Shadowing test members could cause testing issues (such as NRE).

data.name: DoNotUseShadowingMessageFormat
data.value: Member '{0}' already exists in the base class

data.name: DoNotUseShadowingTitle
data.value: Do not use shadowing

data.name: UseProperAssertMethodsTitle
data.value: Use proper 'Assert' methods

data.name: UseProperAssertMethodsMessageFormat
data.value: Use 'Assert.{0}' instead of 'Assert.{1}'

data.name: StringAssertToAssertTitle
data.value: Use 'Assert' instead of 'StringAssert'

data.name: StringAssertToAssertMessageFormat
data.value: Use 'Assert.{0}' instead of 'StringAssert.{1}'

data.name: DataRowShouldBeValidMessageFormat_GenericTypeArgumentNotResolved
data.value: The type of the generic parameter '{0}' could not be inferred.

data.name: DataRowShouldBeValidMessageFormat_GenericTypeArgumentConflictingTypes
data.value: Found two conflicting types for generic parameter '{0}'. The conflicting types are '{1}' and '{2}'.

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_SourceTypeNotPropertyOrMethod
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' is not a property nor a method. Only properties and methods are supported.

data.name: DynamicDataShouldBeValidMessageFormat_SourceTypeNotPropertyMethodOrField
data.value: '[DynamicData]' member '{0}.{1}' is not a property, method, or field. Only properties, methods, and fields are supported.

data.name: UseNewerAssertThrowsTitle
data.value: Use newer methods to assert exceptions

data.name: UseNewerAssertThrowsMessageFormat
data.value: Use 'Assert.ThrowsExactly' instead of 'Assert.ThrowsException'

data.name: AvoidAssertAreSameWithValueTypesTitle
data.value: Don't use 'Assert.AreSame' or 'Assert.AreNotSame' with value types

data.name: AvoidAssertAreSameWithValueTypesMessageFormat
data.value: Use '{0}' instead of '{1}' when comparing value types

data.name: AvoidAssertAreSameWithValueTypesDescription
data.value: Use 'Assert.AreEqual'/'Assert.AreNotEqual' instead of 'Assert.AreSame'/'Assert.AreNotSame' when comparing value types. Passing a value type to 'Assert.AreSame'/'Assert.AreNotSame' will be boxed (creating a new object). Because 'Assert.AreSame'/'Assert.AreNotSame' does the comparison by reference, 'Assert.AreSame' will fail when boxing happens, and 'Assert.AreNotSame' will always pass.

data.name: AvoidUsingAssertsInAsyncVoidContextTitle
data.value: Do not assert inside 'async void' contexts

data.name: AvoidUsingAssertsInAsyncVoidContextMessageFormat
data.value: Do not assert inside 'async void' methods, local functions, or lambdas because they may not fail the test

data.name: AvoidUsingAssertsInAsyncVoidContextDescription
data.value: Do not assert inside 'async void' methods, local functions, or lambdas. Exceptions that are thrown in this context will be unhandled exceptions. When using VSTest under .NET Framework, they will be silently swallowed. When using Microsoft.Testing.Platform or VSTest under modern .NET, they may crash the process.

data.name: UseConditionBaseWithTestClassTitle
data.value: Use 'ConditionBaseAttribute' on test classes

data.name: UseConditionBaseWithTestClassMessageFormat
data.value: The attribute '{0}' which derives from 'ConditionBaseAttribute' should be used only on classes marked with `TestClassAttribute`

data.name: DuplicateDataRowTitle
data.value: Avoid duplicated 'DataRow' entries

data.name: DuplicateDataRowMessageFormat
data.value: Do not duplicate 'DataRow' attributes. This is usually a copy/paste error. The attribute indices are '{0}' and '{1}'.

data.name: UseRetryWithTestMethodTitle
data.value: Use retry attribute on test method

data.name: UseRetryWithTestMethodMessageFormat
data.value: An attribute that derives from 'RetryBaseAttribute' can be specified only on a test method

data.name: PreferTestMethodOverDataTestMethodAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Prefer 'TestMethod' over 'DataTestMethod'

data.name: PreferTestMethodOverDataTestMethodAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: 'DataTestMethod' is obsolete. Use 'TestMethod' instead.

data.name: PreferTestMethodOverDataTestMethodAnalyzerDescription
data.value: 'DataTestMethodAttribute' is obsolete and provides no additional functionality over 'TestMethodAttribute'. Use 'TestMethodAttribute' for all test methods, including parameterized tests.

data.name: UseCooperativeCancellationForTimeoutTitle
data.value: Use 'CooperativeCancellation = true' with '[Timeout]'

data.name: UseCooperativeCancellationForTimeoutMessageFormat
data.value: Use 'CooperativeCancellation = true' with '[Timeout]' to enable cooperative cancellation behavior

data.name: UseCooperativeCancellationForTimeoutDescription
data.value: Using '[Timeout]' without explicitly setting 'CooperativeCancellation = true' is discouraged. In a future version, cooperative cancellation will become the default behavior. Set 'CooperativeCancellation = true' to opt into the recommended behavior and avoid breaking changes.

data.name: TestContextPropertyUsageTitle
data.value: TestContext property cannot be accessed in this context

data.name: TestContextPropertyUsageMessageFormat
data.value: TestContext property '{0}' cannot be accessed in '{1}' method

data.name: TestContextPropertyUsageDescription
data.value: Some TestContext properties are only available during test execution and cannot be accessed in assembly initialize, class initialize, class cleanup, or assembly cleanup methods.

data.name: FlowTestContextCancellationTokenTitle
data.value: Flow TestContext.CancellationToken to async operations

data.name: FlowTestContextCancellationTokenMessageFormat
data.value: Consider using the overload that accepts a CancellationToken and pass 'TestContext.CancellationTokenSource.Token'

data.name: FlowTestContextCancellationTokenDescription
data.value: When calling async methods that have overloads accepting a CancellationToken parameter, prefer using the overload with TestContext.CancellationTokenSource.Token to enable cooperative cancellation and respect test timeouts.

data.name: AssertThrowsShouldContainSingleStatementTitle
data.value: Assert.Throws should contain only a single statement/expression

data.name: AssertThrowsShouldContainSingleStatementMessageFormat
data.value: Assert.Throws should contain only a single statement/expression

data.name: AssertThrowsShouldContainSingleStatementDescription
data.value: Assert.Throws methods should contain only a single statement or expression. Multiple statements can be misleading - if the first statement throws, subsequent statements are never executed; if it doesn't throw, it should be moved outside the Assert.Throws.

data.name: GlobalTestFixtureShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: GlobalTestInitialize and GlobalTestCleanup methods should have valid layout

data.name: GlobalTestFixtureShouldBeValidMessageFormat
data.value: Global test fixture method '{0}' signature is invalid

data.name: GlobalTestFixtureShouldBeValidDescription
data.value:
Methods marked with '[GlobalTestInitialize]' or '[GlobalTestCleanup]' should follow the following layout to be valid: -it can't be declared on a generic class -it should be 'public' -it should be 'static' -it should not be 'async void' -it should not be a special method (finalizer, operator...). -it should not be generic -it should take one parameter of type 'TestContext' -return type should be 'void', 'Task' or 'ValueTask'
The type declaring these methods should also respect the following rules: -The type should be a class -The class should be 'public' -The class shouldn't be 'static' -The class should be marked with '[TestClass]' (or a derived attribute) -the class should not be generic.

data.name: AvoidExplicitDynamicDataSourceTypeTitle
data.value: Avoid passing an explicit 'DynamicDataSourceType' and use the default auto detect behavior

data.name: AvoidExplicitDynamicDataSourceTypeMessageFormat
data.value: Remove the 'DynamicDataSourceType' argument to use the default auto detect behavior
